    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        A Game is a playable game of Noughts & Crosses, AKA Tic-Tac-Toe. Internally, the game is represented as two bit vectors, since my teammates are masochists. Using bit logic, we can decide which numbers represent winning games, complete games, and individual player's moves.

    • Method Detail

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(int i,
            int j)
        Move at the specified spot.
        Parameters:
        i - the row coordinate
        j - the column coordinate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the game is finished, the spot is out of bounds, or the spot is occupied

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(int[] move)
        Move at the specified spot.
        Parameters:
        move - a 2-int array corresponding to [i,j]
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the game is finished, the spot is out of bounds, or the spot is occupied

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public char getCurrentPlayer()
        Get the char of the player who will be moving next.
        Returns:
        'X', 'O', or '\0' if the game is finished

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Check if the game is complete.
        Returns:
        true if the game is finished, false otherwise

      • occupiedBy

        public char occupiedBy(int i,
              int j)
        Returns the player who occupies a space
        Parameters:
        i - the row coordinate
        j - the column coordinate
        Returns:
        the character that occupies the given spot

      • isOccupied

        public boolean isOccupied(int i,
                 int j)
        Tests to see if a space is occupied
        Parameters:
        i - the row coordinate
        j - the column coordinate
        Returns:
        true if the given spot is occupied, false otherwise

      • toMatrix

        public char[][] toMatrix()
        Get a 2D character matrix of the current game
        Returns:
        a 2D char matrix of 'X', 'O', and '\0'

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A 3-line string representation of the current game.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String consisting of 'X', 'O', and '-' with newlines every 3 chars

      • getWinner

        public char getWinner()
        Return the character that has won the game.
        Returns:
        'X', 'O', or '\0' if there is no winner
